model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain helpful and detailed information, enabling the Co-workers A to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT. 

NOTE:
PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY is a summary of the previous dialog, and If the MEMORY contains information that conflicts with the PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY, it is to be regarded as an unhelpful memory.

The output format should be as follows:

Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY:
Co-worker A and Co-worker B met on a movie set and are now good friends.
Co-worker A was initially intimidated by Co-worker B due to their talent as a director.
Co-worker B was nervous about working with Co-worker A because of their talent as an actor.
Both Co-worker A and Co-worker B feel that their collaboration brought out the best in each other during the shoot.
They both believe that their teamwork made the movie a success.
Co-worker A had a tough week on set, feeling overwhelmed and chaotic.
Co-worker B expressed disapproval of Co-worker A's actions and suggested talking to the director to address the stressful situation.
Co-worker A felt remorse for what they did and appreciated Co-worker B's understanding.

CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: I feel so grateful to have a boss who is always so supportive of me.
Co-workers B: That's amazing to hear. Having a supportive boss can make all the difference in how you feel about your job.
Co-workers A: Definitely. It makes me feel secure in my position and motivated to do my best work.
Co-workers B: It's great to have that kind of positive reinforcement. Do you remember when we were working on that movie together and you were feeling really frustrated? 

MEMORY 1:

3. [Co-worker A and Co-worker B met on a movie set and are now good friends.] - (React) - [Co-worker A values the friendship and growth they've experienced with Co-worker B.]

I remember running to my mom and dad whenever I saw one. ### Co-workers B: That's understandable. I mean, some people just have a fear of certain things. ### Co-workers A: Remember when I blew up the rabbit with dynamite? I think I was frustrated with myself and took it out on the poor thing. ### Co-workers B: Yeah, I remember you regretting that decision later on. It's important to find healthy ways to deal with our frustrations. ### Co-workers A: You're right. I need to work on that more. Maybe I can try some relaxation techniques or find a hobby to de-stress. ### Co-workers B: Definitely. It's all about finding what works for you. And maybe facing your fear of spiders can be a part of that process.' }
